sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: REDRUTH a market-town and parish of the county of Cornwall, in the hundred of Penwith, 263 miles from London, and four from Truro. It is situated in the midst of one of the districts most rich in mineral ores, the working of which forms the chief occupation of the inhabitants. It has markets on Tuesday and Friday. The population amounted in 1801 to 4924, in 1811 to 5903, in 1821 to 6607, and in 1831 to 8191.
